name.ingredients: 500g lamb (cut into pieces), 1/2 cup vinegar, 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon red chili powder, 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, 1 teaspoon ground coriander, 1 teaspoon paprika (for color), 2 tablespoons oil, 2 large onions, finely sliced, 2 tomatoes, chopped or pureed, 2-3 green chilies, slit (optional), 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon cumin seeds, 1 teaspoon mustard seeds, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon red chili powder, 1 teaspoon ground coriander, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 1/2 cup water, Fresh coriander leaves for garnish, Salt to taste.
instructions: In a bowl, mix vinegar, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin seeds, ground coriander, paprika, and salt.
Add the lamb pieces and coat them well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and mustard seeds; let them sizzle. Add the sliced onions and cook until golden brown. Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant.
Add chopped or pureed tomatoes and cook until the oil starts separating. Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, ground coriander, and salt. Mix well.

Add the marinated lamb pieces and cook for 5-7 minutes until the lamb is browned. Add 1/2 cup of water, cover, and cook on low heat for 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the lamb is tender and the sauce has thickened. Stir occasionally and add more water if needed.
Stir in garam masala and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with rice or naan.
